publication.abstract: Quantitative microscopy relies on imaging of large cell numbers but is often hampered by time-consuming manual selection of specific cells. The 'Micropilot' software automatically detects cells of interest and launches complex imaging experiments including three-dimensional multicolor time-lapse or fluorescence recovery after photobleaching in live cells. In three independent experimental setups this allowed us to statistically analyze biological processes in detail and is thus a powerful tool for systems biology. Â© 2011 Nature America, Inc. publication.title: Micropilot: Automation of fluorescence microscopy-based imaging for systems biology

summary.description: The Micropilot software from EMBL is a computer program that can rapidly learn what a scientist is looking for in an experiment and then take over the laborious and time-consuming task, automatically performing complex microscopy experiments when it detects cells with interesting features.
summary.name: Micropilot
